reviews.review_msg: 1.0 ratings are from lazy kids. Easiest class I had, just sit back and learn about paintings. No textbook just take lecture notes. Easy to memorize the 57 artworks if you listen in class. Gave us long answer test questions in advance so you knew exactly how to prepare. Don't know how you could get less than a B. Not my major but I'd take again fs.
Her teaching style is a bit bland and does ramble onto different topics. But I'm thankful that she gives out study guides to prepare for the exam. Grading was fair and exams are okay.

She either goes on a whole tangent about things she won't test you on, or say one sentence about things she will test you on. She will ask for feedback and when we give her our honest opinion, she gets supper defensive. She'll ask you to memorize 57 artworks and not include 95% of them on the midterm.

The pacing of the class is horrible. She gave us the outline for the midterm a week before the exam and expected us to remember 57 pieces. She asked us for feedback on the midterm before we even got them back. When people would give criticism, she would get super defensive. In front of the class, she would say who scored well on the exam.
for sfu sca students who have a choice, don't do it. it's not worth your time (notably this class is at a weird time of the day), your energy, and spirit. avoid at all costs

gave us the midterm study guide a WEEK before the midterm with 57 ARTWORKS to memorize. respect for giving us the questions to prepare our short/long answers before the midterm but with the lack of engagement during lectures, youre forced teach yourself the content. learned more from the assigned readings which takes an hour than the lectures

if you have the CHOICE to take this class, DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. asked for feedback on the midterm then got defensive and offended by what students had to say about formatting. we were given 57 works to learn on our own (because she does not teach engagingly) to only be tested on, at most 12 of them.

The epitome of has a PhD credential with zero ability to explain concepts or present knowledge in an engaging way. Complete waste of time and extremely passive aggressive. Asks for feedback then gets extremely defensive with any form of criticism.

Dr. Denise is literally an expert in her field she deserves your respect and your listening ears. I've taken two classes with her, she will pour as much effort into you as you do into the course. With my chronic pain she was empathetic and caring. Dr. Denise is generous with her time in office hours and she is genuinely excited by new ideas!

I walked out of class almost not learning anything. The slides consisted of purely only paintings. As someone in the below said, she relies too much on readings and discussions. She is very monotoned and it is hard to stay focused in the class. Good thing the final was take-home exam due to COVID-19.
